Quote: “I would rather be talking to you," he replied; "but as it seems a matter of justice, it shall be
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “I love you, most ardently...”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “We are all disposed to wonder--but it seems to have been the merciful appointment of Providence that the heart which knew no guile, should not suffer.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “Sjaj i pozlata kriju mnoge mrlje.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “And so well was she able to answer her own expectations, that when she joined them at dinner only two hours after she had first suffered the extinction of all her dearest hopes, no one would have supposed from the appearance of the sisters, that Elinor was mourning in secret over obstacles which must divide her for ever from the object of her love”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “Ένοιωθε ότι μπορεί να εμπιστεύεται πολύ περισσότερο την ειλικρίνεια εκείνων που κάνουν ή λένε καμιά φορά κάτι απρόσεκτο ή βιαστικό, παρά εκείνων που η προσοχή τους δεν διαλείπει ποτέ, η γλώσσα τους δεν ολισθαίνει ποτέ.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “(and Mr. Woodhouse had not married early) was much increased by his constitution and habits; for having been a valetudinarian all his life, without activity of mind or body, he was a much older man in ways than in years; and though everywhere beloved for the friendliness of his heart and his amiable temper, his talents could not have recommended”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “But, however, he did not admire her at all; indeed, nobody can, you know; and he seemed quite struck with Jane as she was going down the dance. So he inquired who she was, and got introduced, and asked her for the two next. Then the two third he danced with Miss King, and the two fourth with Maria Lucas, and the two fifth with Jane again, and the two sixth with Lizzy, and the Boulanger—" "If he had had any compassion for”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “having never believed Frank Churchill to be at all deserving of Emma, was there so much fond solitude, so much keen anxiety for her that he could stay no longer. He had ridden home through the rain; and had walked up directly after dinner, to see how this sweetest and best of all creatures, faultless in spite of all her faults, bore the discovery.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “Mama, the more I know of the world, the more am I convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “Lo que niego es que, con regla general, pueda imponerse la superioridad de un sexo, y que ambos demuestran igual aptitud para todo aquello que está basado en la elegancia y el buen gusto.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “but still, from family attachment and habit, and thorough excellence of mind, he had loved her, and watched over her from a girl, with an endeavour to improve her, and an anxiety for her doing right, which no other creature had at all shared.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “However amiable her temper, her heart was not likely to be easily touched.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “But it is," returned she; "for Mrs. Long has just been here, and she told me all about it.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “She attracted him more than he liked--and Miss Bingley was uncivil to HER, and”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “Upon my word, you five your opinion very decidedly for so young a person.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “Emma was almost ready to sink under the agitation of this moment. The dread of being
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “Pero es destino de toda heroína el verse en ocasión despreciada por el mundo, sufrir toda clase de difamaciones y calumnias y aun así conservar el corazón puro, limpio de toda culpa.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “Ninguna señorita debe enamorarse de un hombre sin que éste le haya declarado previamente su amor, tampoco debe estar bien el que una joven sueñe con un hombre antes de que éste haya soñado con ella.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “I have no notion of loving people by halves; it is not my nature.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “I am sure,” cried Catherine, “I did not mean to say anything wrong; but it is a nice book, and why should not I call it so?” “Very true,” said Henry, “and this is a very nice day, and we are taking a very nice walk, and you are two very nice young ladies. Oh! It is a very nice word indeed! It does for everything. Originally perhaps it was applied only to express neatness, propriety, delicacy, or refinement—people were nice in their dress, in their sentiments, or their choice. But now every commendation on every subject is comprised in that one word.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “I remember hearing you once say, Mr. Darcy, that you hardly ever forgave, that your resentment once created was unappeasable. You are very cautious, I suppose, as to its being created.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “Estaré encantado en hacer que se acostumbre a mi manera de ser.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “alacrity”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “One cannot know what a man really is by the end of a fortnight.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “He is so excessively handsome!”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “Sólo el amor más profundo me hará contraer matrimonio es por eso por lo que terminaré soltera.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “Cuando el tiempo no favorecía sus salidas se encerraban para leer juntas alguna novela. Novela, sí. ¿Por qué no decirlo? No pienso ser como esos escritores que censuran un hecho al que ellos mismos contribuyen con sus obras, uniéndose a sus enemigos para vituperar este género de literatura, cubriendo de escarnio a las heroínas que su propia imaginación fabrica y calificando de sosas e insípidas las páginas que sus protagonistas hojean, según ellos, con disgusto. Si las heroínas no se respetan mutuamente, ¿cómo esperar de otros el aprecio y la estima debidos? Por mi parte, no estoy dispuesta a restar a las mías lo uno ni lo otro. Dejemos a quienes publican en revistas criticar a su antojo un género que no dudan en calificar de insulso, y mantengámonos unidos los novelistas para defender lo mejor que podamos nuestros intereses.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “Uno no ama menos un lugar por haber sufri­do en él, a menos que todo allí no fuera más que sufrimiento, puro sufrimiento.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “I certainly have not the talent which some possess of conversing easily with those I have never seen before.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “They were not welcomed home very cordially by their mother.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “But that expression of 'violently in love' is so hackneyed, so doubtful, so indefinite, that it gives me very little idea. It is as often applied to feelings which arise from a half-hour's acquaintance, as to a real, strong attachment. Pray, how violent was Mr. Bingley's love?”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “A very narrow income has a tendency to contract the mind, and sour the temper.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “La reserva ofrece seguridad, pero no es atractiva. No es posible querer a una persona reservada.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “Catherine lo escuchó estupefacta sin saber a cuál de las dos versiones atenerse. La educación recibida no había preparado su espíritu para mantener charlas tan vanas e insustanciales, ni para esa propensión a la mentira que tantos hombres padecen.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “I am always in love with every handsome man in the world.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “But think no more of the letter. The feelings o the person who wrote, and the person who received it, are now so widely different from what they were then, that every unpleasant circumstance attending it ought to be forgotten. You must learn some of my philosophy. Think only of the past as its remembrance gives you pleasure.”
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: “If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I solemnly swear that I am up to no good.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Of course it is happening inside your head, Harry, but why on earth should that mean that it is not real?”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “It is impossible to live without failing at something, unless you live so cautiously that you might as well not have lived at all - in which case, you fail by default.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “To the well-organized mind, death is but the next great adventure.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “It matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Do not pity the dead, Harry. Pity the living, and, above all those who live without love.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Dumbledore watched her fly away, and as her silvery glow faded he turned back to Snape, and his eyes were full of tears.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “The truth." Dumbledore sighed. "It is a beautiful and terrible thing, and should therefore be treated with great caution.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Do you remember me telling you we are practicing non-verbal spells, Potter?"
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Just because you have the emotional range of a teaspoon doesn't mean we all have.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Numbing the pain for a while will make it worse when you finally feel it.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “We're all human, aren't we? Every human life is worth the same, and worth saving.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Wit beyond measure is man’s greatest treasure.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “We are only as strong as we are united, as weak as we are divided.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Mr. Moony presents his compliments to Professor Snape, and begs him to keep his abnormally large nose out of other people's business.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Indifference and neglect often do much more damage than outright dislike.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “He can run faster than Severus Snape confronted with shampoo.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Is it true that you shouted at Professor Umbridge?"
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Death's got an Invisibility Cloak?" Harry interrupted again.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “You're a prefect? Oh Ronnie! That's everyone in the family!"
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I DON'T CARE!" Harry yelled at them, snatching up a lunascope and throwing it into the fireplace. "I'VE HAD ENOUGH, I'VE SEEN ENOUGH, I WANT OUT, I WANT IT TO END, I DON'T CARE ANYMORE!"
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “It is the unknown we fear when we look upon death and darkness, nothing more.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Not my daughter, you bitch!”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Percy wouldn't notice a joke if it danced naked in front of him wearing one of Dobby's hats.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Books are like mirrors: if a fool looks in, you cannot expect a genius to look out.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “You haven't got a letter on yours," George observed. "I suppose she thinks you don't forget your name. But we're not stupid-we know we're called Gred and Forge.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Don't talk to me."
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “You know, Minister, I disagree with Dumbledore on many counts...but you cannot deny he's got style...”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “We do not need magic to transform our world. We carry all the power we need inside ourselves already.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “He must have known I'd want to leave you."
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Let us step into the night and pursue that flighty temptress, adventure.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Why are they all staring?" demanded Albus as he and Rose craned around to look at the other students.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Fear of a name increases fear of the thing itself.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Cinderella? Snow White? What's that? An illness?”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Dumbledore says people find it far easier to forgive others for being wrong than being right.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Albus Severus," Harry said quietly, so that nobody but Ginny could hear, and she was tactful enough to pretend to be waving to Rose, who was now on the train, "you were named for two headmasters of Hogwarts. One of them was a Slytherin and he was probably the bravest man I ever knew.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I don't believe in the kind of magic in my books. But I do believe something very magical can happen when you read a good book.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “How do you feel, Georgie?" whispered Mrs. Weasley.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “You'll stay with me?'
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Holey? You have the the whole world of ear-related humor before you, you go for holey?”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Now, you two – this year, you behave yourselves. If I get one more owl telling me you've – you've blown up a toilet or –"
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “There was a clatter as the basilisk fangs cascaded out of Hermione's arms. Running at Ron, she flung them around his neck and kissed him full on the mouth. Ron threw away the fangs and broomstick he was holding and responded with such enthusiasm that he lifted Hermione off her feet.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “The thing about growing up with Fred and George," said Ginny thoughtfully, "is that you sort of start thinking anything's possible if you've got enough nerve.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Is 'fat' really the worst thing a human being can be? Is 'fat' worse than 'vindictive', 'jealous', 'shallow', 'vain', 'boring' or 'cruel'? Not to me.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Oh well... I'd just been thinking, if you had died, you'd have been welcome to share my toilet.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Things we lose have a way of coming back to us in the end, if not always in the way we expect.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Yeah, Quirrell was a great teacher. There was just that minor drawback of him having Lord Voldemort sticking out of the back of his head!”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Understanding is the first step to acceptance, and only with acceptance can there be recovery.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Why were you lurking under our window?"
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “It is my belief... that the truth is generally preferable to lies.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “It was, he thought, the difference between being dragged into the arena to face a battle to the death and walking into the arena with your head held high. Some people, perhaps, would say that there was little to choose between the two ways, but Dumbledore knew - and so do I, thought Harry, with a rush of fierce pride, and so did my parents - that there was all the difference in the world.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “One can never have enough socks," said Dumbledore. "Another Christmas has come and gone and I didn't get a single pair. People will insist on giving me books.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Of all the trees we could've hit, we had to get one that hits back.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “He was my mum and dad's best friend. He's a convicted murderer, but he's broken out of wizard prison and he's on the run. He likes to keep in touch with me, though...keep up with my news...check if I'm happy...”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “There are some things you can't share without ending up liking each other, and knocking out a twelve-foot mountain troll is one of them.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Youth can not know how age thinks and feels. But old men are guilty if they forget what it was to be young.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Nitwit! Blubber! Oddment! Tweak!”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Honestly, if you were any slower, you’d be going backward.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Give her hell from us, Peeves.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “You'd think people had better things to gossip about," said Ginny as she sat on the common room floor, leaning against Harry’s legs and reading the Daily Prophet. "Three Dementor attacks in a week, and all Romilda Vane does is ask me if it’s true you’ve got a Hippogriff tattooed across your chest."
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “It is a curious thing, Harry, but perhaps those who are best suited to power are those who have never sought it. Those who, like you, have leadership thrust upon them, and take up the mantle because they must, and find to their own surprise that they wear it well.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “The scar had not pained Harry for nineteen years. All was well.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “He accused me of being Dumbledore's man through and through."
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Ah, music," he said, wiping his eyes. "A magic beyond all we do here!”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Ginny!" said Mr. Weasley, flabbergasted. "Haven't I taught you anything? What have I always told you? Never trust anything that can think for itself if you can't see where it keeps its brain?”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “What happened down in the dungeons between you and Professor Quirrell is a complete secret, so, naturally the whole school knows.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “An Unbreakable Vow?" said Ron, looking stunned. "Nah, he can’t have.... Are you sure?"
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I hope you're pleased with yourselves. We could all have been killed - or worse, expelled. Now if you don't mind, I'm going to bed.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Why are you worrying about YOU-KNOW-WHO, when you should be worrying about YOU-NO-POO? The constipation sensation that's gripping the nation!”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “The last enemy that shall be destroyed is death.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “We do not need magic to transform our world. We carry all of the power we need inside ourselves already.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “It's going to be all right, sir," Harry said over and over again, more worried by Dumbledore's silence than he had been by his weakened voice. "We're nearly there ... I can Apparate us both back ... don't worry ..."
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “You could say sorry," suggested Harry bluntly.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “So light a fire!" Harry choked. "Yes...of course...but there's no wood!" ...
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Seventeen, eh!" said Hagrid as he accepted a bucket-sized glass of wine from Fred.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “You care so much you feel as though you will bleed to death with the pain of it.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I'm going to keep going until I succeed — or die. Don't think I don't know how this might end. I've known it for years.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Don't let the muggles get you down.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Hello, Harry" said George, beaming at him. "We thought we heard your dulcet tones."
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “But Dumbledore says he doesn't care what they do as long as they don't take him off the Chocolate Frog cards.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “You think the dead we loved truly ever leave us? You think that we don't recall them more clearly in times of great trouble?”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Accio Brain!”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “To hurt is as human as to breathe.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Where is Wood?" said Harry, suddenly realizing he wasn't there.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “From now on, I don't care if my tea leaves spell 'Die, Ron, Die,' I'm chucking them in the bin where they belong.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Sometimes you remind me a lot of James. He called it my 'furry little problem' in company. Many people were under the impression that I owned a badly behaved rabbit.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Well, you're expelling us aren't you?" said Ron.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Harry - you're a great wizard, you know."
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Differences of habit and language are nothing at all if our aims are identical and our hearts are open.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Don’t put your wand there, boy! ... Better wizards than you have lost buttocks, you know!”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Does it hurt?" The childish question had escaped Harry's lips before he could stop it.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “The world isn’t split into good people and Death Eaters.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “You should write a book," Ron told Hermione as he cut up his potatoes, "translating mad things girls do so boys can understand them.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Dumbledore's man through and through, aren't you Potter?"
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Ah" said Dumbledore gently, "Yes I thought we might hit that little snag!"
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Fat’ is usually the first insult a girl throws at another girl when she wants to hurt her.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “According to Madam Pomfrey, thoughts could leave deeper scars than almost anything else.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “There's always room for a story that can transport people to another place.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “There is no good and evil, there is only power and those too weak to seek it.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Harry was left to ponder in silence the depths to which girls would sink to get revenge.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Words are, in my not-so-humble opinion, our most inexhaustible source of magic. Capable of both inflicting injury, and remedying it.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Don't worry. You're just as sane as I am.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Harry, don't go picking a row with Malfoy, don't forget, he's a prefect now, he could make life difficult for you..."
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “For instance, this new idea that You-Know-Who can kill with a single glance from his eyes. That’s a basilisk, listeners. One simple test: Check whether the thing that’s glaring at you has got legs. If it has, it’s safe to look into its eyes, although if it really is You-Know-Who, that’s still likely to be the last thing you ever do.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “A breeze ruffled the neat hedges of Privet Drive, which lay silent and tidy under the inky sky, the very last place you would expect astonishing things to happen. Harry Potter rolled over inside his blankets without waking up. One small hand closed on the letter beside him and he slept on, not knowing he was special, not knowing he was famous, not knowing he would be woken in a few hours' time by Mrs. Dursley's scream as she opened the front door to put out the milk bottles, nor that he would spend the next few weeks being prodded and pinched by his cousin Dudley...He couldn't know that at this very moment, people meeting in secret all over the country were holding up their glasses and saying in hushed voices: "To Harry Potter - the boy who lived!”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Every second he breathed, the smell of the grass, the cool air on his face, was so precious: To think that people had years and years, time to waste, so much time it dragged, and he was clinging to each second.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Well?" Ron said finally, looking up at Harry. "How was it?"
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “The mind is not a book, to be opened at will and examined at leisure. Thoughts are not etched on the inside of skulls, to be perused by an invader. The mind is a complex and many-layered thing.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “If you don’t like to read, you haven’t found the right book.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I'll be in my bedroom, making no noise and pretending I'm not there.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “We did it, we bashed them wee Potter's the one, and Voldy's gone moldy, so now let's have fun!”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Your mother died to save you. If there is one thing Voldemort cannot understand, it is love. Love as powerful as your mother's for you leaves it's own mark. To have been loved so deeply, even though the person who loved us is gone, will give us some protection forever.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I want to commit the murder I was imprisoned for.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I don't mean to be rude—" he began, in a tone that threatened rudeness in every syllable.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “After all this time?"
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Did you like question ten, Moony?" asked Sirius as they emerged into the entrance hall.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Harry!" said Fred, elbowing Percy out of the way and bowing deeply. "Simply splendid to see you, old boy-"
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Look...at...me..." he whispered. The green eyes found the black, but after a second, something in the depths of the dark pair seemed to vanish, leaving them fixed, blank, and empty. The hand holding Harry thudded to the floor, and Snape moved no more.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Harry — I think I've just understood something! I've got to go to the library!”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Here lies Dobby, a free elf.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I mean, you could claim that
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I dreamed I was buying new shoes last night," said Ron. "What d'ya think that's gonna mean?"
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Just because it’s taken
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “We'll be there, Harry," said Ron
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Time will not slow down when something unpleasant lies ahead.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Mistletoe," said Luna dreamily, pointing at a large clump of white berries placed almost over Harry's head. He jumped out from under it.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Dumbledore will only leave from Hogwarts when there are none loyal to him!”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Snape's patronus was a doe,' said Harry, 'the same as my mother's because he loved her for nearly all of his life, from when they were children.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Well, I certainly don't," said Percy sanctimoniously. "I shudder to think what the state of my in-tray would be if I was away from work for five days."
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I enjoyed the meetings, too. It was like having friends.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Who're you going with, then?" said Ron.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “What was there to be gained by fighting the most evil wizard who has ever existed?" said Black, with a terrible fury in his face. "Only innocent lives, Peter!"
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Whether you come back by page or by the big screen, Hogwarts will always be there to welcome you home.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “It is a strange thing, but when you are dreading something, and would give anything to slow down time, it has a disobliging habit of speeding up.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “As much money and life as you could want! The two things most human beings would choose above all - the trouble is, humans do have a knack of choosing precisely those things that are worst for them.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Ginny, listen...I can't be involved with you anymore. We've got to stop seeing each other. We can't be together."
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “What would come, would come...and you would have to meet it, when it did.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “When you have seen as much of life as I have, you will not underestimate the power of obsessive love.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “This is night, Diddykins. That's what we call it when it goes all dark like this. ”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “So top grade's O for 'Outstanding,'" Hermione was saying, "and then there's A-"
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “The last words Albus Dumbledore spoke to the pair of us?'
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Can't stay long, Mother," he said. "I'm up front, the prefects have got two compartments to themselves-"
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “DUMBLEDORE'S ARMY, STILL RECRUITING.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Anyone can speak Troll. All you have to do is point and grunt.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “There is an expiry date on blaming your parents for steering you in the wrong direction; the moment you are old enough to take the wheel, responsibility lies with you.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “But this is touching, Severus,” said Dumbledore seriously. “Have you grown to care for the boy, after all?”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “When in doubt, go to the library.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Are you insane? Of course I want to leave the Dursleys! Have you got a house? When can I move in?”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Hogwarts, Hogwarts, Hoggy Warty Hogwarts,
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Hogwarts was the first and best home he had known. He and Voldemort and Snape, the abandoned boys, had all found home here. ”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I make mistakes like the next man. In fact, being--forgive me--rather cleverer than most men, my mistakes tend to be correspondingly huger.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “So that's little Scorpious. Make sure you beat him in every test, Rosie. Thank god you've inherited your mother's brains.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Malfoy glanced around. Harry knew he was checking for signs of teachers. Then he looked back at Harry and said in a low voice, "You're dead, Potter."
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Just then Neville caused a slight diversion by turning into a large canary.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I’m never wearing them," Ron was saying stubbornly. "Never."
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “How're we getting to King's Cross tomorrow, Dad?" asked Fred as they dug into a sumptuous pudding.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “For future reference, Harry, it is raspberry...although of course, if I were a Death Eater, I would have been sure to research my own jam preferences before impersonating myself.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “What are you doing with all those books anyway?" Ron asked.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “By all means continue destroying my possessions. I daresay I have too many.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I have one last hope for you, which is something that I already had at 21. The friends with whom I sat on graduation day have been my friends for life. They are my children’s godparents, the people to whom I’ve been able to turn in times of trouble, friends who have been kind enough not to sue me when I’ve used their names for Death Eaters. At our graduation we were bound by enormous affection, by our shared experience of a time that could never come again, and, of course, by the knowledge that we held certain photographic evidence that would be exceptionally valuable if any of us ran for Prime Minister.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “What's that?" he snarled, staring at the envelope Harry was still clutching in his hand. "If it's another form for me to sign, you've got another -"
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “No story lives unless someone wants to listen. The stories we love best do live in us forever. So whether you come back by page or by the big screen, Hogwarts will always be there to welcome you home.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “The best of us must sometimes eat our words.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Luna had decorated her bedroom ceiling with five beautifully painted faces: Harry, Ron, Hermione, Ginny, and Neville. They were not moving as the portraits at Hogwarts moved, but there was a certain magic about them all the same: Harry thought they breathed. What appeared to be fine golden chains wove around the pictures, linking them together, but after examining them for a minute or so, Harry realized that the chains were actually one word, repeated a thousand times in golden ink:
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I am sorry too," said Lupin. "Sorry I will never know [my son]... but he will know why I died and I hope he will understand I was trying to make a world in which he could live a happier life.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Have you ever seen anything quite as pathetic?" said Malfoy. "And he’s supposed to be our teacher!"
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Killing is not so easy as the innocent believe.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Swish and flick.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I wish...I wish
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Would it hurt to die?”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I really feel that we're not giving children enough credit for distinguishing what's right and what's wrong. I, for one, devoured fairy tales as a little girl. I certainly didn't believe that kissing frogs would lead me to a prince, or that eating a mysterious apple would poison me, or that with the magical "Bibbity-Bobbity-Boo" I would get a beautiful dress and a pumpkin carriage. I also don't believe that looking in a mirror and saying "Candyman, Candyman, Candyman" will make some awful serial killer come after me. I believe that many children recognize Harry Potter for what it is, fantasy literature. I'm sure there will always be some that take it too far, but that's the case with everything. I believe it's much better to engage in dialog with children to explain the difference between fantasy and reality. Then they are better equipped to deal with people who might have taken it too far.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Great, tell me when you've defeated Voldemort for me, will you?”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “You think I'm a fool?" demanded Harry.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Depression is the most unpleasant thing I have ever experienced. . . . It is that absence of being able to envisage that you will ever be cheerful again. The absence of hope. That very deadened feeling, which is so very different from feeling sad. Sad hurts but it's a healthy feeling. It is a necessary thing to feel. Depression is very different.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “You will find that I will only truly have left this school when none here are loyal to me.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “So why in the name of Merlin’s saggy left —”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “HELLO? HELLO? CAN YOU HEAR ME? I-WANT-TO-TALK-TO-HARRY-POTTER!”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Alas! Earwax!”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Harry looked around; there was Ginny running toward him; she had a hard blazing look in her face as she threw her arms around him. And without thinking, without planning it, without worrying about the fact that fifty people were watching, Harry kissed her. After several long moments, or it might have been half an hour-or possibly several sunlit days- they broke apart.”

Quote: “Mischief Managed.”

Quote: “It unscrews the other way.”

Quote: “Well, we were always going to fail that one," said Ron gloomily as they ascended the marble staircase. Quote: “Curiosity is not a sin.... But we should exercise caution with our curiosity... yes, indeed.”

Quote: “Autumn seemed to arrive suddenly that year. The morning of the first September was crisp and golden as an apple.”

Quote: “First sign of madness, talking to your own head.”

Quote: “As is a tale, so is life: not how long it is, but how good it is, is what matters.

Quote: “I took a wrong turn on the way to the bathroom and found myself in a beautifully proportioned room I had never seen before, containing a really rather magnificent collection of chamberpots. When I went back to investigate more closely, I discovered that the room had vanished. But I must keep an eye out for it. Possibly it is only accessible at five thirty in the morning. Or it may only appear at the quarter moon - or when the seeker has an exceptionally full bladder.”

Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “The Death Eaters can't all be pure-blood, there aren't enough pure-blood wizards left," said Hermione stubbornly. "I expect most of them are half-bloods pretending to be pure. It's only Muggle-borns they hate, they'd be quite happy to let you and Ron join up"

Quote: “Don't play," said Hermione at once.

Quote: “Hermione launched herself forwards and started punching every inch of him that she could reach.

Quote: “Voldemort himself created his worst enemy, just as tyrants everywhere do! Have you any idea how much tyrants fear the people they oppress? All of them realize that, one day, amongst their many victims, there is sure to be one who rises against them and strikes back!”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Ron," said Hermione in a dignified voice, "you are the most insensitive wart I have ever had the misfortune to meet.”

Quote: “I'm Draco Malfoy, I'm Draco, I'm on your side!"

Quote: “And Harry saw very clearly as he sat there under the hot sun how people who cared about him had stood in front of him one by one, his mother, his father, his godfather, and finally Dumbledore, all determined to protect him; but now that was over. He could not let anybody else stand between him and Voldemort; he must abandon forever the illusion he ought to have lost at the age of one, that the shelter of a parent’s arms meant that nothing could hurt him. There was no waking from this nightmare, no comforting whisper in the dark that he was safe really, that it was all in his imagination; the last and greatest of his protectors had died, and he was more alone than he had ever been.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “There's nothing better when something comes and hits you and you think 'YES'!”

Quote: “I've never stunned anyone except in our D.A. lessons," said Luna, sounding mildly interested. "That was noisier than I thought it would be.”

Quote: “The consequences of our actions are always so complicated, so diverse, that predicting the future is a very difficult business indeed.”

Quote: “The mind is a complex and many-layered thing, Potter... or at least, most minds are...”

Quote: “What you fear most of all is —fear. Very wise...”

Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “What’s comin’ will come, an’ we’ll meet it when it does.”

Quote: “Hearing voices no one else can hear isn't a good sign, even in the wizarding world.”

Quote: “I’ll make Goyle do lines, it’ll kill him, he hates writing,” said Ron happily. He lowered his voice to Goyle’s low grunt and, screwing up his face in a look of pained concentration, mimed writing in midair. “I... must... not... look... like... a... baboon’s... backside.”

Quote: “Hermione drew herself to her full height; her eyes were narrowed and her hair seemed to crackle with electricity.

Seemed to think I cared more about winning the Cup than I do about staying alive. Just because I told her I didn't care if it threw you off, as long as you caught the Snitch first.”

Quote: “Ooh, you look much tastier than Crabbe and Goyle, Harry" said Hermione, before catching sight of Ron's raised eyebrows, blushing slightly and saying "oh you know what I mean - Goyle's Potion looked like bogies.”

Author: JK Rowling

Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I believe your friends Misters Fred and George Weasley were responsible for trying to send you a toilet seat. No doubt they thought it would amuse you.”

Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “And it's Gryfindor in possession again, as Johnson takes the Quaffle— Flint alongside her —poke him in the eye, Angelina —it was a joke, professor, it was a joke...”

Quote: “And they'd [the Death Eaters] love to have me," said Harry sarcastically. "We'd be best pals if they didn't keep trying to do me in.”

Quote: “Slowly, very slowly, he sat up, and as he did so he felt more alive, and more aware of his own living body than ever before. Why had he never appreciated what a miracle he was, brain and nerve and bounding heart? It would all be gone...or at least, he would be gone from it. His breath came slow and deep, and his mouth and throat were completely dry, but so were his eyes.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Well, I can certainly see why we're trying to keep them alive. Who wouldn't want pets that can burn, sting, and bite all at once?”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “You are the true master of death, because the true master does not seek to run away from Death. He accepts that be must die, and understands that there are far, far worse things in the living world than dying.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Am I about to discover where you, Ron, and Hermione disappeared to while you were supposed to be in the back room of Fred and George's shop?'
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “You must accept the reality of other people. You think that reality is up for negotiation, that we think it's whatever you say it is. You must accept that we are as real as you are; you must accept that you are not God.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “But they were not living, thought Harry: They were gone. The empty words could not disguise the fact that his parents' moldering remains lay beneath snow and stone, indifferent, unknowing. And tears came before he could stop them, boiling hot then instantly freezing on his face, and what was the point in wiping them off or pretending? He let them fall, his lips pressed hard together, looking down at the thick snow hiding from his eyes the place where the last of Lily and James lay, bones now, surely, or dust, not knowing or caring that their living son stood so near, his heart still beating, alive because of their sacrifice and close to wishing, at this moment, that he was sleeping under the snow with them.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Can you think what the Mirror of Erised shows us all?" Harry shook his head.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I don't think you should be an Auror, Harry," said Luna unexpectedly. Everybody looked at her. "The Aurors are part of the Rotfang Conspiracy, I thought everyone knew that. They're working to bring down the Ministry of Magic from within using a mixture of dark magic and gum disease.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Ask us no questions and we’ll tell you no lies.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Did you see me disarm Hermione, Harry?"
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “You fail to recognize that it matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be!”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Rock bottom became the solid foundation on which I rebuilt my life.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Which came first, the phoenix or the flame?”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Our Headmaster is taking a short break,' said Professor McGonagall, pointing at the Snape-shaped hole in the window.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Oh, HONESTLY, don't you two read?”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Hermione had taken his hand again and was gripping it tightly. He could not look at her, but returned the pressure, now taking deep, sharp gulps of the night air, trying to steady himself, trying to regain control. He should have brought something to give them, and he had not thought of it, and every plant in the graveyard was leafless and frozen. But Hermione raised her wand, moved it in a circle through the air, and a wreath of Christmas roses blossomed before them. Harry caught it and laid it on his parent's grave.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “When we come face-to-face with one down a dark alley, we're going to be having a shufti to see if it's solid, aren't we, we're not going to be asking, 'Excuse me, are you the imprint of a departed soul?”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Ah, Harry, how often this happens, even between the best of friends! Each of us believes that what he has to say is much more important than anything the other might have to contribute!”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I love magic!”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “October extinguished itself in a rush of howling winds and driving rain and November arrived, cold as frozen iron, with hard frosts every morning and icy drafts that bit at exposed hands and faces.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “It was strange how your brain could know what your heart refused to accept.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “You do not seek to kill me, Dumbledore?” called Voldemort, his scarlet eyes narrowed. “Above such brutality, are you?”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Do I look stupid?" snarled Uncle Vernon, a bit of fried egg dangling from his bushy mustache.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “You are protected, in short, by your ability to love!”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Oh, it can't be a reference to the fact Harry's a great Seeker, that's way too obvious. There must be a secret message from Dumbledore hidden in the icing!”

Quote: “Muggles have garden gnomes, too, you know," Harry told Ron as they crossed the lawn.

Quote: “Greatness inspires envy, envy engenders spite, spite spawns lies.”

Quote: “They heard the click of the mail slot and flop of letters on the doormat.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Mr. and Mrs. Dursley, of number four Privet Drive, were proud to say that they were perfectly normal, thank you very much.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Oh please," said Zacharias Smith, rolling his eyes and folding his arms. "I don't think Expelliarmus is exactly going to help us against You-Know-Who, do you?"

Quote: “Well you seemed too busy to call him a prat and I thought someone should.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Fred and George turned to each other and said together, 'Wow, we're identical!'
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I thought it sounded a bit like Percy singing... maybe you've got to attack him while he's in the shower, Harry.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Call him Voldemort, Harry. Always use the proper name for things. Fear of a name increases fear of the thing itself.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “From this point forth, we shall be leaving the firm foundation of fact and journeying together through the murky marshes of memory into thickets of wildest guesswork.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “You see!" said a strained voice. Tonks was glaring at Lupin. "She still wants to marry him, even though he's been bitten! She doesn't care!"
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I am what I am, an’ I’m not ashamed. 'Never be ashamed,’ my ol’ dad used ter say, ‘there’s some who’ll hold it against you, but they’re not worth botherin’ with.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “We must try not to sink beneath our anguish, Harry, but battle on.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “If he doesn't stop trying to save your life he's going to kill you.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I open at the close.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Severus Snape wasn't yours," said Harry. "Snape was Dumbledores, Dumbledores from the moment you started hunting down my mother...”

Quote: “I have gone temporarily deaf and haven't any idea what you said, Harry.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “You will also find that help will always be given at Hogwarts to those who ask for it.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “IF WE DIE FOR THEM, I'LL KILL YOU, HARRY!”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I'll fix it up with Mum and Dad, then I'll call you. I know how to use a fellytone now—"
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “You are nearly there," said James. "Very close. We are...so proud of you.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Harry and Hermione are very platonic friends. But I won't answer for anyone else, nudge-nudge wink-wink!”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “No, thanks," said Harry. "The toilet's never had anything as horrible as your head down it— it might be sick." Then he ran, before Dudley could work out what he'd said.”

Quote: “It's lucky it's dark. I haven't blushed so much since Madam Pomfrey told me she liked my new earmuffs.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Oh, there you are, Albus,' he said. 'You've been a very long time. Upset stomach?'
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Listeners, that brings us to the end of another Potterwatch. We don’t know when it will be possible to broadcast again, but you can be sure we shall be back. Keep twiddling those dials: the next password will be ‘Mad-Eye.’ Keep each other safe. Keep faith. Good night.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “His hand closed automatically around the fake Horcrux but in spite of everything, in spite of the dark and twisting path he saw stretching ahead for himself, in spite of the final meeting with Voldemort he knew must come whether in a month in a year or in ten, he felt his heart lift at the thought that there was still one last golden day of peace left to enjoy with Ron and Hermione.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “What's most important in a friendship? Tolerance and loyalty.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Anything's possible if you've got enough nerve.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Like the fact that the person Sirius cared for the most about in the world was you," said Dumbledore quietly.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Harry Potter was a highly unusual boy in many ways.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “They’re evacuating the younger kids and everyone’s meeting in the Great Hall to get organized. We’re fighting.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Just think how many books I could've sold if Harry had been a bit more creative with his wand." -[On the success of 50 Shades of Grey]”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I sometimes find, and I am sure you know the feeling, that I simply have too many thoughts and memories crammed into my mind.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I'll join you when Hell freezes over," said Neville. "Dumbledore's Army!" he shouted, and there was an answering cheer from the crowd, whom Voldemort's Silencing Charms seemed unable to hold.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Well, obviously, she's feeling very sad, because of Cedric dying. Then I expect she's feeling confused because she liked Cedric and now she likes Harry, and she can't work out who she likes best. Then she'll be feeling guilty, thinking it's an insult to Cedric's memory to be kissing Harry at all, and she'll be worrying about what everyone else might say about her if she starts going out with Harry. And she probably can't work out what her feelings towards Harry are anyway, because he was the one who was with Cedric when Cedric died, so that's all very mixed up and painful. Oh, and she's afraid she's going to be thrown off the Ravenclaw Quidditch team because she's flying so badly."
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Rita looked as though she would have liked nothing better than to seize the paper umbrella sticking out of Hermione's drink and thrust it up her nose.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Oh, of course," said Ron, clapping a hand to his forehead. "I forgot we'll be hunting down Voldemort in a mobile library.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Beds empty! No note! Car gone — could have crashed — out of my mind with worry — did you care? — never, as long as I’ve lived — you wait until your father gets home, we never had trouble like this from Bill or Charlie or Percy —"
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “My word, Severus, that I shall never reveal the best of you?’ Dumbledore sighed, looking down into Snape’s ferocious, anguished face. ‘If you insist …”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “She was a very pretty woman. She had dark red hair and her eyes -- her eyes are just like mine, Harry thought, edging a little closer to the glass. Bright green -- exactly the same shape, but then he noticed that she was crying; smiling, but crying at the same time. The tall, thin, black-haired man standing next to her put his arm around her. He wore glasses, and his hair was very untidy. It stuck up at the back, just like Harry's did.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “The three of them fell silent. After a long pause, Hermione voiced the knottiest question of all in a hesitant voice.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “What exactly is the function of a rubber duck?”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “It was as if Snape had started handing out sweets.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are far more than our abilities.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “But people only die in proper duels, you know, with real wizards. The most you and Malfoy’ll be able to do is send sparks at each other. Neither of you knows enough magic to do any real damage. I bet he expected you to refuse, anyway.”

Quote: “P.S. I enjoy acid pops.”

Quote: “Oh, are you doing magic? Let’s see it, then.”

Quote: “Ron's indignation on his behalf was worth about a hundred points to him.”

Quote: “I WILL NOT TOLERATE MENTION OF YOUR ABNORMALITY UNDER THIS ROOF!”

Quote: “Sounded like a load of waffle to me."

Quote: “You've sort of made up for it tonight,' said Harry. 'Getting the sword. Finishing off the Horcux. Saving my life.'

Quote: “But who could bear to know which stars were already dead, she thought, blinking up at the night sky; could anybody stand to know that they all were?”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Go on, have a pasty," said Harry, who had never had anything to share before or, indeed, anyone to share it with. It was a nice feeling, sitting there with Ron, eating their way through all Harry's pasties, cakes, and candies (the sandwiches lay forgotten).”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “She's as nutty as squirrel poo. ”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Longbottom, if brains were gold, you'd be poorer than Weasley, and that's saying something.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Hang on . . .” Harry muttered to Ron. “There’s an empty chair at the staff table. . . . Where’s Snape?”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Some wounds run too deep for the healing.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “A fierce battle was raging inside Harry's brain:
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “As Harry and Ron rounded the clump of trees behind which Harry had first heard the dragons roar, a witch leapt out from behind them.

Quote: “I feel I owe you another explanation Harry," said Dumbledore hesitantly. "You may, perhaps, wondered why I never chose you as a prefect? I must confess...that I rather thought...you had enough responsibility to be going on with."

Quote: “You never get it right, you people, do you? Either we've got Fudge, pretending everything's lovely while people get murdered right under his nose, or we've got you, chucking the wrong people into jail and trying to pretend you've got 'The Chosen One' working for you!”

Quote: “Next time there’s a ball, ask me before someone else does, and not as a last resort!”

Quote: “Professor Kettleburn, our Care of Magical Creatures teacher, retired at the end of last year in order to enjoy more time with his remaining limbs.”

Quote: “And he knew that at that moment, they understood each other perfectly, and when he told her what he was going to do now, she would not say ‘be careful’ or ‘don’t do it’, but she would accept his decision because she would not have expected anything less of him.”

Quote: “Harry, you wonderful boy, you brave, brave man.”

Quote: “We do not need magic to change the world, we carry all the power we need inside ourselves already: we have the power to imagine better.”

Quote: “No man or woman alive, magical or not, has ever escaped some form of injury, whether physical, mental, or emotional. To hurt is as human as to breathe.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Gosh, what a gripping story. You must have been simply terrified. Meanwhile we went to Godric's Hollow and, let's think, what happened there, Harry? Oh yes, You-Know-Who's snake turned up, it nearly killed both of us, and then You-Know-Who himself arrived and missed us by about a second. Imagine losing fingernails, Harry! That really puts our sufferings into perspective, doesn't it?”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I was supposed to be waiting up here when you got back, only your Phoenix lot got in the way...”

He pulled himself up on the nearest chair, looked around through lopsided horn - rimmed glasses and said, 'Am I too late? Has it started? I only just found out, so I - I -'

Quote: “Once again you've put your keen and penetrating mind to the task and as usual come to the wrong conclusion!”

Quote: “I see you are —”

Quote: “Be ruthless about protecting writing days, i.e., do not cave in to endless requests to have "essential" and "long overdue" meetings on those days. The funny thing is that, although writing has been my actual job for several years now, I still seem to have to fight for time in which to do it. Some people do not seem to grasp that I still have to sit down in peace and write the books, apparently believing that they pop up like mushrooms without my connivance. I must therefore guard the time allotted to writing as a Hungarian Horntail guards its firstborn egg.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Of course we still want to know you!" Harry said, staring at Hagrid.

Harry heard the high voice shriek as he too yelled his best hope to the heavens, pointing Draco's wand:

Quote: “Imagination is not only the uniquely human capacity to envision that which is not, and, therefore, the foundation of all invention and innovation. Quote: “It’s so difficult to describe depression to someone who’s never been there, because it’s not sadness. I know sadness. Sadness is to cry and to feel. But it’s that cold absence of feeling— that really hollowed-out feeling.”

Quote: “You'd think I walk around with my eyes shut, banging off the walls.”

Quote: “You can exist without your soul, you know, as long as your brain and heart are still working. But you’ll have no sense of self anymore, no memory, no . . . anything. There’s no chance at all of recovery. You’ll just — exist. As an empty shell. And your soul is gone forever . . . lost.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “But...surely you know where your nephew is going?' she asked, looking bewildered.

Quote: “And Hermione was struggling to her feet in the wreckage, and three red-headed men were grouped on the ground where the wall had blasted apart. Harry grabbed Hermione's hand as they staggered and stumbled over stone and wood.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “There is a room in the Department of Mysteries, that is kept locked at all times. It contains a force that is at once more wonderful and more terrible than death, than human intelligence, than forces of nature. It is also, perhaps, the most mysterious of the many subjects for study that reside there. It is the power held within that room that you possess in such quantities and which Voldemort has not at all. That power took you to save Sirius tonight. That power also saved you from possession by Voldemort, because he could not bear to reside in a body so full of the force he detests. In the end, it mattered not that you could not close your mind. It was your heart that saved you.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “How in the name of Merlin's pants have you managed to get your hands on those Horcrux books?”

Quote: “I don’t expect you will really understand the beauty of the softly simmering cauldron with its shimmering fumes, the delicate power of liquids that creep through human veins, bewitching the mind, ensnaring the senses...”

Quote: “I always advise children who ask me for tips on being a writer to read as much as they possibly can. Jane Austen gave a young friend the same advice, so I'm in good company there.”

Some people, perhaps, would say that there was little to choose between the two ways, but Dumbledore knew —

Quote: “Whatever house I'm in, I hope she's not in it.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “You look in excellent health to me, Potter, so you will excuse me if I don't let you off homework today. I assure you that if you do die, you need not hand it in.”

Quote: “Witness for the defense, Albus Percival Wulfric Brian Dumbledore.”

Quote: “He sounds exactly like Moody," said Harry quietly, tucking the letter away again inside his robes. "'Constant vigilance!' You'd think I walk around with my eyes shut, banging off the walls....”

Quote: “Imperfect understanding is often more dangerous than ignorance.”

Quote: “I never meant to call you Mudblood, it just-"

Quote: “He read the letter again, but could not take in any more meaning than he had done the first time and was reduced to staring at the handwriting itself. She had made her g's the same way he did : he searched through the letter for every one of them, and each felt like a friendly little wave glimpsed from behind a veil. The letter was an incredible treasure, proof that Lily Potter had lived, really lived, that her warm hand had once moved across this parchment, tracing ink into these letters, these words, words about him, Harry, her son.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “He couldn't know that at this very moment, people meeting up in secret all over the country were holding up their glasses and saying in hushed voices: 'To Harry Potter - the boy who lived!”

Quote: “In dreams, we enter a world that’s entirely our own.”

Quote: “Help will always be given at Hogwarts to those who ask for it.”

Quote: “If you have to ask, you’ll never know. If you know, you need only ask.”

Quote: “Time is Galleons, little brother.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Sure you can manage that broom, Potter?" said a cold, drawling voice.

Quote: “Fools who wear their hearts proudly on their sleeves, who cannot control their emotions, who wallow in sad memories and allow themselves to be provoked this easily — weak people, in other words...”

Quote: “He's not a child!" said Sirius impatiently.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I love you, Hermione,” said Ron, sinking back, rubbing his eyes wearily.

Quote: “You see, I, unlike you, have been made a prefect, which means that I, unlike you, have the power to hand out punishments.”

Quote: “I have spied for you and lied for you, put myself in mortal danger for you. Everything was supposed to be to keep Lily Potter’s son safe. Now you tell me you have been raising him like a pig for slaughter —”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Where your treasure is, there will your heart be also”

Quote: “Jacob: Newt . . . I don't think I'm dreaming.

Quote: “It was so good to be held. If only their relationship could be distilled into simple, wordless gestures of comfort. Why had humans ever learned to talk?”

Quote: “The stories we love best do live in us forever.”

Quote: “My Head of House said I lacked certain necessary qualities...like the ability to behave myself.”

Quote: “You - will - never - touch - our - children - again!' screamed Mrs. Weasley.

Quote: “Such loyalty is admirable, of course,” said Scrimgeour, who seemed to be restraining his irritation with difficulty, “but Dumbledore is gone, Harry. He’s gone.”

Quote: “She picked up the book and then walked back past him into the tent, but as she did so, she brushed the top of his head lightly with her hand. He closed his eyes at her touch, and hated himself for wishing that what she said was true: that Dumbledore had really cared.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Oh, shut up Weatherby.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “He felt his heart pounding fiercely in his chest. How strange that in his dread of death, it pumped all the harder, valiantly keeping him alive. But it would have to stop, and soon. Its beats were numbered. How many would there be time for, as he rose and walked through the castle for the last time, out into the grounds and into the forest?”

Quote: “This liberating discovery enables me to proceed without any fear that I might inadvertently influence you to abandon promising careers in business, law or politics for the giddy delights of becoming a gay wizard.”

Quote: “What is the difference, Potter, between monkshood and wolfsbane?"

Quote: “Black’s gaunt face broke into the first true smile Harry had seen upon it. The difference it made was startling, as though a person ten years younger were shining through the starved mask; for a moment, he was recognizable as the man who had laughed at Harry’s parents’ wedding.”

Quote: “Nothing like a nighttime stroll to give you ideas.”

Quote: “Somewhere out in the darkness, a phoenix was singing in a way Harry had never heard before: a stricken lament of terrible beauty. And Harry felt, as he had felt about phoenix song before, that the music was inside him, not without: It was his own grief turned magically to song..”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Harry, suffering like this proves you are still a man! This pain is part of being human —”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “As for the fact that Malfoy, Crabbe, and Goyle apeared to be going their different ways when they were usually inseparable, these things happened as people got older--Ron and Hermione, Harry reflected sadly, were living proof.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “You’d think a bit of kissing would cheer her up.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Do you see, Harry? Do you see the flaw in my brilliant plan now? I had fallen into the trap I had foreseen, that I had told myself I could avoid, that I must avoid.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “You are — truly your father’s son, Harry. . . .”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “But some part of him realized, even as he fought to break free from Lupin, that Sirius had never kept him waiting before. . . . Sirius had risked everything, always, to see Harry, to help him. . . . If Sirius was not reappearing out of that archway when Harry was yelling for him as though his life depended on it, the only possible explanation was that he could not come back. . . . That he really was . . .”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “You think the dead we loved ever truly leave us? You think that we don’t recall them more clearly than ever in times of great trouble? Your father is alive in you, Harry, and shows himself plainly when you have need of him.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Ron: Why spiders? Why couldn't it be "follow the butterflies?”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “HARRY, THIS IS NO TIME TO BE A GENTLEMAN!" Wood roared as Harry swerved to avoid collision. "KNOCK HER OFF HER BROOM IF YOU HAVE TO!”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “She can't keep writing about what a tragic little hero I am, it'll get boring.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “See, they're currently in alien terrain, surrounded by millions of the most vicious creatures on the planet. Humans. - Newt Scamander”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “We Slytherins are brave, yes, but not stupid. For instance, given the choice, we will always choose to save our own necks.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “When he straightened up again, there were six Harry Potters gasping and panting in front of him.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “George: "I can't see anyone trying to bump off a quidditch team."
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Let me out," Harry said again.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “But from that moment on, Hermione Granger became their friend. Because there are somethings you can't go through in life and become friends, and knocking out a twelve-foot mountain troll is one of them.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Enjoying it? I don’t reckon he’d come home if Dad didn’t make him. He’s obsessed. Just don’t get him on the subject of his boss. According to Mr. Crouch…as I was saying to Mr. Crouch… Mr. Crouch is of the opinion… Mr. Crouch was telling me… They’ll be announcing their engagement any day now.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “What she did have were Bertie Bott's Every Flavor Beans, Drooble's Best Blowing Gum, Chocolate Frogs, Pumpkin Pasties, Cauldron Cakes, Licorice Wands, and a number of other strange things Harry had never seen in his life.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “I think so,' said Professor McGonagall dryly, 'we teachers are rather good at magic, you know.”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “When we were in Diagon Alley,' Harry began, but Mr. Weasley forstalled him with a grimace.
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Oh you is a bad elf, Dobby!”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Potter! There are hundreds of people thundering through my pub!”
Author: JK Rowling

Quote: “Hermione turned and beamed at Harry; her eyes, too, were full of tears.
Author: JK Rowling
